name: I Love You, But BFFR Podcast

episodes.title: How People Fall Into Cults Today: The Algorithm, Faith, and the Communities We Trust
episodes.description:
In this solo episode, together we’ll break down the biggest lessons I learned from interviewing cult survivors, and why you’re one bad breakup, one identity crisis, or one click away from being in the next Netflix cult documentary.
We cover:
• Who actually gets pulled into cults (it’s not “weak” people)
• Financial control, purity culture, and patriarchy as recruitment tools
• How YouTube pastors and online “healing” spaces become cult pipelines
• Why moms, athletes, and isolated young couples are especially vulnerable
• How cults separate you from your support system mentally before they separate you physically
• What leaving really looks like, and how survivors rebuild

Based on real stories shared this season, including Jehovah’s Witness escapees, purity-culture survivors, autism moms, anti-Zionist Jewish organizers, and a Straitway Truth Ministries survivor.

episodes.title: The Pro Athlete to Cult Pipeline: Inside Straitway Truth Ministries
episodes.description:
A YouTube sermon. A young husband searching for leadership. A family pulled into a high-control religious group. Financial freedom stripped away in the name of devotion.

In this episode, India talks with Coach Therna C. Wade, a proud wife and mom of six and cult escapee of Straitway Truth Ministries, about how modern cults recruit families through the guise of spirituality and improvement —starting with men searching for “biblical masculinity” and ending with entire homes under control.

They discuss:
The “athlete-to-cult” pipeline and militant masculinity
How men are groomed to distrust their partners
Financial exploitation and religious fear
Escaping with five kids, a pregnant wife, and $1400

episodes.title: Escaping Jehovah’s Witnesses: How A Cult Survivor Reclaimed Her Power
episodes.description:
In this SEASON PREMIERE, India talks with ex-Jehovah’s Witness, life coach, and founder of The Exodus Group, AngieBe, about what it means to rebuild your identity after leaving a high-control religion.

We break down how cult dynamics mirror abusive relationships, how fear replaces intuition, and how to escape a culty situation if you need.

The Details:
● We’re all susceptible to being in a cult
● Being born into a religious cult: Angie’s experience as a Jehovah’s Witness
● The moment Angie believed 9/11 was God’s punishment for her having sex
● How cults train you out of your intuition
● Finding community after being shunned from the only community you ever had
● Reclaiming your power and starting over
